title: Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was intimidating, asked relèvent questions. Hard to think on the spot but If you’re good at that you should be okay. There are 2 managers sitting in the room while asking you questions
Interview Questions: To calculate a tube feeding formula

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Common interview process. Meeting with HR and head nurse. Questions about nursing knowledge and case studies. They really want to test your critical thinking and capacity to prioritize. Once you are chosen they call you within a week.
Interview Questions: They give you 4 scenarios of fictive patients ask you to prioritize their care

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The process was fast and the interviewers were nice. It went smoothly.  The questions were pertinent to the unit. My interview was through zoom.  I was interviewed by 2 people

title: Summer Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very kind and comprehensive. She seemed very interested in me and my career. She was encouraging and willing to help me attend my goals. She was discussing with me all the possibilities and offers.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my studies and my career goals

title: Administrative Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: First Interview was done on zoom . Employee was very kind and asked straightforward questions and all of my questions and concerns were clarified. Then upon hiring theirs a lot of paper work to fill out .
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Why do you want to work with us ? What is your weakness?

title: Unit Agent Class II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Call from HR representative to schedule interview with herself and unit manager.
Interview on Zoom due to COVID pandemic, about 45 minutes in length. Questions both situational as well as personal (career goals, previous employment experience, education, etc.)
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult patients

title: Unit Agent Class II (Recall) Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Got in through a friend who works there. I have a feeling that your connections and who you know are very important. I was contacted by someone from HR for an initial phone interview. Questions: -confirm your name
-Where did your graduate from( all schools)
-Availability 
-description Of the position 
After the the phone interview I was sent an administrative test which is comprised of: English language, French language, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint. You only get the results at your main interview. After that I had a scheduled interview with the HR representative and a unit manager on Zoom ( virtual)  due to Covid pandemic.

title: CPNP (Candidate for the Profession of Nursing) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: There are two rounds of interviews. First round is phone interview, some questions like why would you be a nurse, why do you select to work for the hospital/unit. Then 2nd round, there are two interviewers in the procedure. one is the HN, the other from HR. The interview may take place in HN's office, or conference room. I directly submitted my CV to HN as I did my clinical on that ward.
Interview Questions: I applied for internal medicine ward. The questions are about how to administer the meds, how to give insulin, when should you call MD, what is you midterm goal, etc.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Asked typical interview questions (i.e. tell us about yourself, why should we hire you) and included clinica scenarios regarding common diagnosis such as COPD, diabetes, fractures etc... The type of diagnosis would depend on the unit you are interviewed for.
Interview Questions:
Q: What tests would be done for an elderly patient with a fall
Q: What is one quality you do not like in other colleagues

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: sent the resume, then after a month i've received a call for an interview with a committee of 4 persons. The interview was good and everything was smooth. I had personality questions and cases
Interview Questions:
why you want to work at the jgh?
tell us about your experience?
How do you manage a project from a to z

title: Unit Agent Class II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 interview process. you do a computer (excel/word test about 15-30 multiple choice questions) followed by a language test. The skills test is long. After that, I waited about a week or so, HR calls and  they set up an interview with you , the HR person and your boss for final interview.
Interview Questions: If you had the call bell that rings, the telephone rings , a doctor who asks for you to send a patient down for a test and a visitor by your desk asking you for directions, in which order of priority do you go about the tasks?

title: Postdoctoral Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very helpful, average in difficulty and welcoming. People who work at the company were very inviting and great. The atmosphere of the company is very organized and nice. The position is very exciting and intriguing.
Interview Questions:
What are the skills that prepared you for this position?
Why did you choose our company?
Why do you think you are a proper and good fit for this position?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process provided me with great experience and was  fair. The atmosphere was stimulating and the supervisor was so kind. I would definitely recommend the place for future prospect who are interested in developing their careers.
Interview Questions: What are your accomplishments and strengths?

title: CPNP (Candidate for the Profession of Nursing) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online. Unlike most other applicants, I never received a call from HR, but directly from the head nurse. She invited me for an interview.  Had the interview in her office with the nurse educator. They were very casual and warm. Most questions were very typical interview questions (in any field). If you spend an hour or two watching youtube videos about nursing interviews you'll do well. They also asked a case study question. They did not expect me to know the answer but were more interested in my thought process and reasoning. I thought I did horrible but got a call the very next day saying I got the job.
Interview Questions: My patient had a bowel resection two days ago and has been vomiting twice a shift since. Describe your assessment and interventions. (Something along those lines)

title: Network Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: There were a lot of questions about Networking and teamwork. The questions about teamwork were more difficult because the answers can be different for different companies. And it is difficult to understand which answer is right for which company. I did my best but I do not know about were my answers correct.
Interview Questions:
Networking:
- Protocols
- Troubleshooting
- Routing
- Switching
- Cisco configuration
etc

Teamwork:
- Many questions about teamwork
etc

title: Hospital Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone call approximately a month later. It was comprised of interviews by HR, in-person tests and once hired, there was a physical to pass on-site. Following this, they advised me that they could place me in a variety of positions or departments as needed.
Interview Questions: The toughest part of the interview was when they asked multiple "scenario" type questions but overall it was laid back and low pressure.I was made an offer within two months of my initial application.

title: Administrative Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: it was pleasant and the staff was nice.  I met with the main person responsible for technicians then the manager for that department.  both were pleasant.  they tested me in both official languages written and spoken.
Interview Questions: Am I experienced in office work.  Testing was also performed

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jewish General Hospital (Montreal, QC) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Head nurse and her assistant (always 2 nurses), we were in a closed room, they looked the type of clothes that I was wearing,  how much eye contact that I gave , they were asking lots of personal questions
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here? why do you travel so ? (they wanted to see that the candidate is someone stable that is not going to leave after passing the licensing exam)
